Posts.Content: I am looking for some thoughts on my next steps from this awesome forum: Pre-Operation: PSA: 5.2 - May 2014 (age: 56) Biopsy Aug. 2014: 3 cores positive for adenocarcinoma (out of 12). Gleason Score: (3+4, 3+3, 3+4)/ Tissue: 35%, 7%,25%, T1c, Perineural Invasion: Not Identified Bone scan imaging, MRI etc... no evidence of metastatic disease RP Operation: 10/2014 Surgical Pathological Exam Histlogic grade: Gleason (3+4 =7), tumor: 5 to 10% of tissue, extraprostatic extension: not present, seminal vesicle invasion: not identified, margins: uninvolved by carcinoma, lymph-vascular invasion: not identified, perineural invasion: present, Pathological staging: Primary Tumor T2c bilateral disease, Regional Lymph Node: NO, number examined: 13, number involved: 0, distant metastatis: NA PSA post-surgery 4/28/16 PSA <0.1 4/28/17 PSA =0.1 6/20/18 PSA =0.2 Consultation with Urologist - 07/2018 Recommendation salvage therapy with radiation (no need for hormonal therapy per Urologist) I am having a second PSA test and I am also seeking a second opinion. Please provide your thoughts on the best course of action with respect to radiation therapy only. And any issues with side effects etc... A BIG THANK YOU.
Posts.Title: Prostate Cancer Recurrence - PSA rising after Prostate Surgery - next steps?

Posts.Content: Thanks for the feedback. The URO did not provide a good rationale for why he thought RT without HT should be adequate. He even said I could still wait a bit before deciding. I do not want to dally. I am having a second opinion. I will have a consultation with the RO within the next few days. I checked one of the calculator on the MSKCC. With my data, the success of non-recurrence after 6 years jumped from 64% (RT) to 81% (RT+HT). Not sure how much reliability can one put on these on-line calculators.
